title: Adorable moment between Meghan Markle and baby Archie in intimate unseen clip
text:

Meghan Markle lovingly kisses her son Archie on the head in a previously-unseen clip from a trailer for a new documentary on her Africa trip with Prince Harry .

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex were seen with little Archie during a royal engagement in South Africa, where they introduced their four-month-old son to Archbishop Desmond Tutu.

The royal couple look smitten with their baby boy in the trailer for Harry and Meghan: An African Journey.

Harry, 35, is bouncing his little boy in his arms and Meghan then sweetly kisses Archie and strokes him in the head in the adorable moment which was captured by cameras.

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex gave royal fans their first full glimpse of their four-month-old son as they took him for tea with the Archbishop and his daughter, Thandeka Tutu-Gxashe in September.

With the royal couple sharing several behind-the-scenes videos of the engagement on their Instagram account, some fans have picked up on Meghan’s adorable nickname for her baby boy as they listened closely to the clip.

In one video, the Duchess can he heard trying to get Archie to wave for the Archbishop, with Meghan calling him “bubba” twice.

“Say hello! Hello, hi!,” mum Meghan says, before little Archie snuggles up to her and starts to drool.

Giggling while holding her son, the Duchess says: “Oh, Bubba!” Meghan is then heard calling Archie “bubba” again in a second video of the couple walking up to the legacy foundation building in Cape Town.

Meghan was seen carrying her son, who is giddy with excitement, while wearing a patterned black and white Club Monaco dress with pointed-toe black heels.

The stylish Duchess looked glamorous as ever as she sported the £368 dress, as she wore her long dark hair tied back neatly.

Meghan is clearly over-the-moon to have her son with her for the engagement as she smiles happily while holding his hand.

Doting dad Harry, who is seen wearing a suit and tie, also flashes a smile at his adorable son, who is seen sporting cute baby blue dungarees paired with a white long-sleeve top.

The royal couple shared the video to their popular Instagram account alongside the caption “Arch meets Archie!"Later on in the day, the Duchess visited a Cape Town support group named Mothers2Mothers which trains and employs mothers with HIV.

Meghan later gifted some of the guests with clothes which belonged to her son as gifts to the mothers at the engagement.

She said: "Here’s a few little things that I thought would be helpful."

Meghan then held up a babygro with the words “The Future” emblazoned across the front, with the Duchess adding: “The Future. And he’s outgrown his Invictus one."

She later told the guests: “I just thought that, in the spirit of community, what's so nice is to be able to share some of the things that we have at home as well.

"And so we can obviously make sure everything you need is provided for you, but we've brought some of the things that my friends and I used for our kids and Archie, that don't fit anymore."
description: A forthcoming ITV documentary called Harry and Meghan: An African Journey will look at their royal tour earlier this year
